CWOh-2pOJPjuYKbBEqekxw.text: Excellent Indian food near Euston station. The all-you-can-eat buffet is delicious and very good value for money (especially if your appetite is as big as mine...). A few months ago, I turned up with a group of 10 people without booking and the accommodated us without a second thought. Useful if you're in the area with a large group and want to sit down and eat somewhere. I will definitely go back.

KASMUO5B__P7jBF9iBe5zw.text: Came back to Chutneys- 2nd visit here after our last" holiday" Nov. 2014. Great place for dinner, prices are VERY reasonable and food taste great. This place is just too far from our home (LA, California) to come every week. Try it- you'll like it...

1M91lbXg083I_USk0nOHyQ.text: Great lunch buffet, with so many options that if you just took a bite of each, you still couldn't get through all of them.  It is all vegetarian but none of my carnivorous friends have ever left hungry.  And it's a fantastic value, buffet and a mango lassi for under a tenner.Dessert is sparse (fruit, gulab jamun--balls of dough in syrup--and  rice pudding,) but if you like Indian sweets, Royal Sweets is next door and world famous.Dinner is prepared fresh and is delicious, especially the dosas.

MN3beG2WjXw2veHNPjv0TA.text: It's hard to better Berry's review, but three years later it is still all true. prices have gone up a little, but it still serves very good South Indian vegetarian cuisine, with an excellent buffet, but (unlike Diwana down the road) it is licensed so serves beer and wine. It is also a proper restaurant in feel, rather than a cafe, so better for a night out. A decent meal for two (I had a Thali  a complete meal of dhal, curry, rice, chapati, and raita) with a large beer each came to just over £15 a head, including tip.

Q2jjSk_-zz2rTuB-YAg1mw.text: Excellent restaurant. Best Indian food I've had in London so far... Superb service, cheap prices and delicious food.

xOz9yaZG2iAujWgqpblTXw.text: I'm not the biggest vegetable guy but this place is F-ing amazing. Definitely some of the best vegetarian food I've ever had. I went twice while in London, and I can verify that you get a lot of food for what you pay. My party of 4 ordered 2 orders of rice & chapati, and 3 curries for a total of ... 24£! And we left full.

pEl4WLSDdanFWEWp2Pd0tw.text: Went there Sunday for the buffetVery cheapQuite good4 of us for £27 (exc tip) nice!

tMLqlFYabyLlSFaHrL-Jtw.text: My favorite place to eat in London! I always go for the lunch buffet, and typically am so stuffed I hardly have to eat any dinner. Also it's a great value! I've come here with numerous people, and everyone has loved the food (even non-veggies!). Very highly recommended! The only reason I didn't give this restaurant five stars is because on several occasions the staff has been less than friendly. But the food keeps me coming back!

0R8z9__zm0Mu9lsfmlA59A.text: I was introduced to Chutney's 20 years ago by an a fellow vegetarian Indian boyfriend, and I have not found a vegetarian restaurant to beat it since. Called chutney's after the vast choice of chutney's on offer with your meal, the food is delicious & the Cobra beers ice cold (Needed if you go for the hotter dishes/chutney's) I can't recommend the unbelievably cheap Sunday buffet highly, enough, the choice of dishes are vast & very varied, from mild to red hot, with a choice of breads & salads & if you have any room left, dessert. Anyone who thinks vegetarian food is boring & all the same, should take an advantage of a all day Sunday, or one of their weekday lunch time buffets, and sample what your missing!! (Might be best to wear elasticated waistband trousers tho, as you might bust a zip or button!!) I can't recommend this restaurant highly enough, but don't just take my word for it, go there & put it to the test!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom

UC_Eu0dS_DqT6LdQlm0krQ.text: The food wasn't that great, and the service was mediocre. When I asked for fresh puri (as part of the buffet), they refused saying this is all they had (they had pretty stale puri left over from a previous batch).

YbVR_mKJBKCIdlf1zaG71Q.text: My buddy and I went there on a recommendation not knowing it was vegetarian.  For a second it took us off guard but proceeded to order and we were not disappointed.  We asked for extra spicy and they delivered very flavorful (and spicy) dishes.  The vegetables and seasonings were so good, we both said the absence of meat was not an issue at all.

CNrkCJZqQc1Y19udSKpPMQ.text: First time I went I there the food was pretty poor, but the second time I ordered something different and it was actually quite tasty, although nothing revolutionary. The staff aren't particularly friendly and can get a bit irate with large groups, but it's all very efficient. Overall good value, but only okay.

Gu2wjRQYmemXhVDui8ePwQ.text: You'll never find me using revolting old clichés like cheap and cheerful but seeing as those Chutneys begins with a ch it's probably an apt description. Well it's not that cheerful - ordering loads of plates of curries and spicy dishes is serious business. It's the scoffing and knowing that everything on the menu is vegetarian, (which means I don't need to look for the little v symbols next to the food) that makes me happy.I can't remember the interior. It's obviously no Alan Yau but hey, who cares when there's so much eating to do. The only really horrible thing, other than been forced to use clichés, is... omg I can't even say it... instant coffee. Yes folks, in this day and age it's true. Take your own in a flask if you dare.

3lhoIBJuYzWIapiYgrV1Cw.text: The BEST value for money in London for Indian food, especially as far as buffets go. Who's heard of an all you can eat at lunch during the week and all day on Sundays for £6.95???!!! That's right and believe you me it's certainly well worth it. Usually, there are around 8-12 salads and 4 curry plus a dhal, rice, breads and sweets (not to forget CHEAP organic wines / to be poaid extra for). But it's a 'as much you can eat' buffet and friendly service to boot. These must be some of the remaining good guys in an otherwise not very cheap town! Don't change menu, don't change prices, in fact DON'T CANGE ANYTHING!!!

WYbgfAxmGVKvwjMqmzyZrA.text: Great and friendly place to eat - we go there with friends about twice a year when in London. Wonderful choices for vegetarians and vegans and it's all really delicious! The last reviewer gave more detail so I'm just agreeing with him/her really!

photos.caption: Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom. One of the 'Paper Dhosa' meals at Chutneys, London!

scyLtK0-LvgOvopSaoZkmg.text: Pretty good buffet-style vegetarian food. I didn't miss my meat while I was eating here. Only the desserts left something to be desired in my opinion. Friendly staff, reasonable prices. My only warning is that the space is very small -- I felt that I was getting in peoples' way while going back and forth from my table to the buffet.

SXRZpSQTSVz8quOS3EyBOQ.text: Chutney's is one of Drummond Street's Southern Indian vegetarian restaurants, at the further end from Euston station. It serves dhosas (sort of pancake like things filled with potato and eaten with green coconut chutney) as well as more conventional curries. It does a choice of incredible behl pooris (crunchy concoctions of puffed rice, potatoes, herbs - difficult to describe but incredible to taste) a variety of unusual and delicious main courses. Most noteworthy, though, is their lunchtime and Sunday buffet. The range is incredible! It is full of healthy choices - vegetables somehow made to taste wonderful, fruits, chutney, of course - as well as curries and wonderful deserts. I would leave room for a lot of food - don't eat breakfast before you go, as you'll want to try everything more than once. Oh, and the prices are very good indeed.

slk8RY6YdTMmEW2b6LfA6g.text: Go here on a Sunday before 2pm for their magnificent eat all you can for £5.95 deal. Not only are there curries and rices, but there are a range of Indian breads, sides such as saag aloo, cold Indian salads and desserts. Drinks are very reasonably priced too. The place does look a little scruffy but don't let that put you off, the food is amazing.

Y5nEFvRpDpSWiUQo-OlpVA.text: Great restaurant! Friendly staff and excellent food. High standard Vegetarian Indian cuisine.

1OoyzeVY8iofREV0UMbBTA.text: Skip this place: they have 0/5 hygiene rating and are in need of urgent improvement. Like all of the indian buffets on this street, it is not sanitary. -No sneeze guard-Sign requesting only one plate per person (yuck)-The bathrooms/toilets are a mess: dirty, smelly, dingy, and no paper towels available. Like most buffets on this street, there weren't any southern indian items. They also provide very poor service: I was never provided with a beverage, nor even asked if I wanted one. They did remind me that service wasn't included in the bill. Since I received no service, I didn't pay for any. I like dinner service better, but it was nothing worth going out of your way for. Dinner service was more like ££, cost wise.

photos.caption: Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom. 0 of 5 for hygiene!  NASTY!

UucpyBDymlqe4ItETOKQ5Q.text: One of the best options among all the vegetarian Indian buffets in the area. Slightly less variety than Diwana, but definitely better quality for the same price (plus, the buffet includes chutneys!). Come here for the lunch buffet and don't bother with the regular menu. Make sure you use the same plate every time you get more food, and don't pick up extra silverware at the end of the buffet line, because you have some at your table and you'll be scolded for getting more. That said, load up your plate and don't stop eating until you physically can't move (just don't ask me what any of the dishes are).

76LM9jj3ArTtnPKJi7rnVQ.text: Nice chaat and soul food place. Good variety on the menu - north/south Indian and Gujarati. Fast and good service. And very reasonably priced. Loved the veg biryani. Close to Regent Park, perfect after a nice stroll there.

photos.caption: Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom. Veg biryani

YpHTzqm7YIPWmDzfND0eVg.text: Great little Vegetarian Indian Buffet venue near to London Euston. Simple decor, friendly service and £6.95 for great food. What's not to like?

FXE2YgNVTFMDjPgOFP7ELA.text: Looking back, it seems as though there was a touch of destiny and fate that caused me to walk into Chutneys during my vacation in London.  Why do I say that you might ask?  Well, two reasons specifically: 1) my friends and I were only in the neighborhood because we went to take pictures at 187 North Gower Street/Speedy's Cafe since we're big Sherlock fans and wanted to see the location for the show's 221B Baker Street, and 2) although it subsequently has closed, one of my favorite Indian restaurants back home in Hawaii was also called Chutney, so the name played to my palate preferences.From the exterior, there really isn't much to mention.  There isn't any special decor or signage, nor is there anything that would really set them apart from some of the other Indian cuisine restaurants in relatively  near vicinity.  Additionally, the interior, although clean and surprisingly spacious, also lacked anything of note that would really set them apart.The menu was pretty standard fare for your typical Indian place, and I'm fairly certain any Indian food fan would be able to find something to satisfy their lunch or dinner cravings.  I don't know about any of you, but when I go to a new Indian restaurant I tend to stick to my default favorite order of chana masala and plain naan.  And what was the verdict?  I am happy to say that Chutneys didn't disappoint.  The chick peas were not over-cooked and mushy, which is a culinary pet peeve of mine.  The naan was also cooked well and maintained that nice chew and subtle burnt flavor/charring that characterizes that style of bread.  And maybe the most appealing note for tourists and budget-watchers alike, the prices at Chutneys are very reasonable, especially for the portion sizes.  Coming from Hawaii, I like to think that we have it pretty bad when it comes to cost of living and price of goods/services.  But holy crap London makes Hawaii look cheap.  So you can best believe I was grateful for a bargain when I saw it!Although Chutneys is a little off the beaten path, especially since I've been there done that regarding the Sherlock thing, when I go back to London--I enjoyed my time there so much that it's not an if, but when--I know I'll be on the look out for delicious Indian restaurants.  So, who's to say that my stomach won't make an executive decision to jump on the tube and make my way back to Chutneys?  If you're in the area, or hell, if you're just looking for some place good to eat, give Chutneys a try.  You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom. Chana masala (with plain and garlic naan in the background)

3PfHuzMsjVSP5ceF5UQW6Q.text: Really good, you get a massive dosai from 7.30. The texture is perfect, and though it took a while for them to get to, you could tell that it was very well done. I also had the samosas which were good, if not spectacular.

NPYvBuopaVIFesgx5DDqhw.text: Just come here for the weekdays lunch buffet. It's cheap and epic. Atmosphere and staff are traditional but in a nice way, also great for casual business lunches. Every time I come here I leave happily stuffed with great food. I feel blessed with having this place so close to home! Only tip: do not leave anything on your plate, it's a real waste.

E7pUYPFx778FY6bbpw5PZA.text: Though the restaurant was packed half an hour after we arrived, we walked in a little before 19:00 on a Saturday night and it was almost empty, so we were able to get a table for 2 right away. Everything on the menu seemed delicious and they had a great vegetarian selection. My friend asked for the least spicy dish, which the waiter said would be the channa masala, so she ordered that and I ordered the Bombay Aloo, which was supposed to be very hot potato curry. But we realised after we started eating that her dish was actually spicier than mine, so we just split both of them. The waiter also gave my friend a complimentary side of yogurt to counteract the spiciness, which was very nice of him (and the yogurt was delicious). I enjoyed the channa masala more than the potatoes, because the potatoes were very large and I didn't think the dish had quite enough curry. I ordered coconut rice with my meal, which I didn't expect to finish, but I enjoyed it so much that I ate the whole serving. We also split garlic naan, which was very large and complimented the curries very well. The great service continued: After we finished dinner, the waiter brought us complimentary ice cream to share, telling us they they were about to officially start selling it the next day. We guessed the flavours were ginger, mango, and pistachio, and agreed that the pistachio was our favourite. It was a very refreshing end to a lovely meal, and only cost both of us about £10. We came very hungry and left very satisfied, and we'll definitely be back for another dinner or for the lunch buffet.

ErgI3BXjBfIPvOKty0vbtw.text: This place was awesome! I got the Thali which came with 4 curries, 2 rotis, a gulab jamun dessert, and some raita yoghurt. I thought the food was amazing, and I had just studied abroad in India last semester, and this place had food almost nearly as good as I had eaten in western India. It was just more pricey than I was expecting (29 dollars/ 20 pounds). All in all, I would recommend this place. When I asked for the check/ cheque, however, the guy seemed annoyed that I did not use manners and say the words "May I please have..." Haha I guess that's not a thing we do in America. Normally in the U.S., the waiter brings us the check/ cheque the second after you finish your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom. I ordered a thali with 4 curries, raita yoghurt, some pakoras, 2 rotis, some basmati rice, a gulab jamun dessert, and a mango lassi.
Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom. I ordered a thali with 4 curries, raita yoghurt, some pakoras, 2 rotis, some basmati rice, a gulab jamun dessert, and a mango lassi.
Photo of Chutneys - London, United Kingdom. A dhal (split peas) soup

RMjgwgQCcybeMPzNkPid1Q.text: Chutney's is my favourite of a number of similar vegetarian South Indian restaurants on Drummond Street. I am a great fan of the arrangement in place on Sundays, when for the entire day they operate an all-you-can-eat buffet deal for a fixed price. Really delicious food: I've no idea what half of it is, but I pile it up on my plate and then return for a second helping of a similar amount. Highly recommended.

2-Z02lnvfU0DJph5dvvRMw.text: Better than Diwana! They serve naan here and a greater variety of curries. Also I liked the desserts more. They had this moist sponge cake like dessert with powdered sugar on top which was pretty good. £6.95 for all you can eat and we saw people waiting outside at 11:50 right before they opened. Tons of locals which probably means it's one of the better places to try!;)

LN-5X00a3WEQEFS59o26uA.text: You can only use one plate for the buffet. And if you unknowingly get a second plate, the waiter will come to your table to tell you that you shouldn't have done that. Never seen such rude people!

QrEhP145SzTX-PDzJ1LKEw.text: We had their lunch buffet, which is a great way to try a wide variety of their dishes, then pig out on the ones you like best.  A huge bargain too.  And the staff are lovely.

qZr-dBmQUATX6Dkt6O-SBg.text: Chutney's is my favourite place so far to eat on Drummond Street, and all of the Indian options on the street are pretty good ones. It's all vegetarian and really reasonably priced. The lunch buffet is under £7 and comes with a large array of different dishes, each one delicious. I wish the bread they offered was a bit softer but that was my only real gripe about the food. The daal was delicious, my friend saying it was just like the ones she had when she spent a year in Sri Lanka. The dinner choices are great too and similarly cheap. I really enjoyed the saag paneer I had here. The service was pretty much what I'd expect, I've never had a bad experience with them.It's definitely a good choice if you're in the area, especially if you're veggie or have veggie friends you need to feed!

CqHJNvaTWDz9BtD0swl0ag.text: Oh Chutneys. I always leave you feeling uncomfortably full and sorely in need of a 4-hour nap. Drummond Street is lined with fantastic little Indian restaurants like this one. They do a vegetarian lunch buffet for £7. They rotate the dishes, but there's usually a selection of 7-8 hot dishes and 4-5 cold salads, plus the usual sides of naan, rice, and lots of sauces.I'm not a vegetarian but every time I come here, the concept of moderation completely goes out the window. It's quick, delicious, and cheap -- what else could you want?

QXhTJ8A6f1S4dkolZKUmPw.text: I came here for lunch one day with a bunch of co-workers because one of them was leaving and we were having a farewell lunch. In case you haven't figured it out, Chutneys is an vegetarian Indian buffet, and for lunch, it's a great deal as it's only £6.95pp. Surprisingly, the food was pretty good. There were a few dishes that I thought were quite spectacular (the onion bhajis, the taro leaves and the cauliflower dish), but the curries themselves were just kinda average. I do prefer my curries a bit hotter. But they were quite nice. The desserts were actually quite good, and I'm a huge fan of Gulab Jamun. The only downside is the service. You're pretty much ignored once you give them your drink order. I did have to ask for water several times. But for less than a tenner and unlimited vegetarian curry, perhaps you have to make do.

pL7W6ZGswNWEjbAO1d2fsw.text: Wouldn't recommend. I am surprised to read great reviews because I regret my visit. We ordered dahi bhalla chat. The vada was hard and didn't seem fresh at all. I suspect the imli chutney came from a jar from the spice shop next door. We also got a rava dosa which was actually great but was ruined by terrible chutneys and sambhar. What they called coconut chutney was a watery mix of coconut flakes, I have even used the same to make chutney at home because my blender can't grate well but even that comes out better than whatever this was. It also had a yogurty tanginess so only the cook knows what it was but wasn't coconut chutney. The sambhar was average. The masala tea was watery. Not sure if this is one of those places catering to mainly British crowd, if you are looking for authentic- don't waste your time and money.

F3dQFrthHD9RZ0VupMb0Kw.text: Summary: food is tasty, service is bad, even by London standards. I came with my flatmate, and they didn't check with us once the entire time - we had to flag a server down to order, and then after they brought us our food, we waited a long time and flagged them down again for the bill. Good thing we were feeling chatty and not in a hurry.But the food was good enough that I almost went with 4 stars just for that. It's all vegetarian, which I love. The Chutney's Special dosa was especially delicious - a type of flatbread with a tasty dipping sauce. The price is also very reasonable, especially for London. I'd like to come back for the lunch buffet sometime, when I don't have to worry about the service!

MpZmH6VAC_aGQ0wCEb3kcg.text: This little gem is tucked away at the back of Euston Station, perfect as I was having lunch with as friend just before catching a train. I had one eye on the time so was relieved to find there was a buffet, eliminating the need to wait to be served (I imagine that may have taken as while as it was pretty busy) whilst offering a great selection of dishes to choose from, and all at the bargain price of £6.95. The entirely veggie offerings included several curries, bhajis, bread, popadoms and a wonderful choice of salads. I sampled most of the dishes and whilst they were by no means the most mind-blowing Indian food I've tasted, they were all hearty, well spiced and not too greasy. For desert I was treated to a big plate of melon as well as some more traditional Indian sweets, perfect after the large main course. Although it was a little chaotic with the tightly packed tables full to capacity, the service was friendly and the atmosphere relaxed and pleasant. What a great find!
